message.content:
Iris douglasiana is a species of flowering plant in the Iris family. It is commonly known as the Douglas iris.
The flower petals are typically purplish-blue to lavender in color, with a distinct yellow crest on the falls.
The flowers have six petals arranged in a star shape and the leaves are long and narrow. 
The texture of the flower is velvety and soft, with a slightly waxy surface.
Iris douglasiana is often found in coastal areas and wetlands in California and Oregon.
It can be used as an ornamental plant in gardens and landscaping.
The plant has also been used for medicinal purposes by indigenous peoples of the Pacific Northwest.
